titles: The Westminster wonder: giving an account of a robin-red-breast, who, ever since the queens funeral continues on the top pinacle of the queens mausoleum or pyramid, in the Abby of Westminster, where he is seen and heard to sing, and will not depart the place, to the admiration of many beholders. : To the tune of The jealous lover. : Licensed according to order.
publisher: Printed for James Read near Temple-Barr,
notes: Reproduction of original in: Newberry Library, Chicago, Illinois.
keywords: Mary --  II, --  Queen of England, 1662-1694 --  Death and burial --  Poetry.
